results.title: The Supervisor as a leader. Part 2
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in supervision”
Four supervisors discuss the qualities of leadership with the assistance of dramatised incidents. One supervisor lets his job go to his head, while another goes to pieces under pressure. Emphasises that a good supervisor is not afraid to praise his colleagues for work well done and that he is loyal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids

results.title: The Supervisor as a leader. Part 1
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in supervision”
Several workmen are asked what they consider to be the attributes of a good supervisor. The four most important qualities are: always keep promises, never take credit for someone else’s work, don’t pass the buck and don’t play favourites

results.title: Supervising workers on the job
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Problems in supervision”
Various kinds of poor supervision practices are shown, among them, nagging, snooping, etc. By dramatised incidents, the poor results of these methods are made apparent and the better ways indicated.

results.title: Supervising women workers
results.creator_credit: Herbert Kerkow and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A factory foreman discusses with the supervisor the “problem” of supervising women workers in his department. The fact is brought out that the same rules apply in supervising both men and women; but, “as women often have not had as much industrial experience as men, and in most cases have more home responsibilities than men, these factors must be taken into account”. Note that this film was made in 1944 and uses such terms as “breaking in” the female workers and “the eternal feminine”. Interesting from a historical point of view.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Herbert Kerkow and United States. Office of Education
results.description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.

Note that this film was made in 1944 and uses such terms as “breaking in” the female workers and “the eternal feminine”. Interesting from a historical point of view.

results.title: A New supervisor takes a look at his job
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A young worker has just been made a line supervisor; in an interview with the superintendent, he is told that in his new job he must learn to get results by working with people instead of with machines.

results.title: Maintaining workers interest
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various workers are shown doing poor work because their work holds no interest for them. The point is made that the supervisor should be alert to detect and remedy these situations wherever possible.

results.title: Maintaining quality standards
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various scenes emphasise the nature of quality standards. The role of the supervisor in maintaining quality as well as quantity is made clear by incidents involving poor instruction, carelessness, and lack of pride in good workmanship.

results.title: Maintaining good working conditions
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Presents several cases where an improvement in working conditions resulted in increased production. The importance of the part which must be played by supervisors in maintaining good working conditions is stressed.

results.creator_credit: Caraval Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A new worker is being started in his job; his induction is done poorly, and the worker shows considerable dissatisfaction with his treatment. A demonstration of how a worker should be introduced to his new job is then given.
results.title_for_label: Introducing the new worker to his job

results.title: Improving the job
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A film about reducing accidents and waste in the factory workplace by involving workers.
